website_summaries.verdict: Superior Rowenta performance and all the features you've come to expect from this quality manufacturer, but 25% lower energy consumption than other steam irons makes this model a winner.
pros: 1700 watts of power and 180 g/min of steam production quickly remove wrinkles from fabric
Three settings: dry for steam-free ironing, boost for extra steam, and eco for energy savings without loss of steam power
cons: None to speak of, but a few customers say the iron leaked when used

customer_reviews.title: Yes it leaks
customer_reviews.text: It gets hot, it irons clothes.... However, the iron leaks water. It leaks even when in the DRY position. It leaks, its a flaw and I would like to return it. Its a pain to add water and to empty every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect iron
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to iron while he watches sports on television. He had been complaining about our old iron for months. So, I decided to buy him a new iron for our anniversary. No joke. I researched irons with the features he said he wanted and found the Rowenta Eco- Intelligence. It is relatively lightweight and it's sharp point allows you to get into all corners of a garment. He found the controls easy to understand and use and said the instruction book was very helpful in learning about the iron. He especially likes the maneuverability and the Eco feature.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Epic
customer_reviews.text: I have had only three irons in my lifetime. I buy quality and prefer long lasting items. I treat my iron well. This is exceptional. I like all the bells and whistles. REMEMBER TO ALWAYS EMPTY THE WATER OUT SO NO RUST AND TURN THE DIAL ALL THE WAY DOWN BEFORE UNPLUGGING YOUR IRON AND IT WILL LAST MUCH LONGER Made in Germany is a PLUS ...Had no idea some were made in China, Didn't want to chance it
customer_reviews.author: C Hull

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have had this iron for a little over 10 months and it has begun to leak very badly. I'm passed the window of time when I can return it. It' s a made-in-Gerrmany Rowena, which is supposed to be about the best iron you an buy. I am going to have to replace it, but I will not replace it with another Rowena. Apparently that company's quality control has slipped badly.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R. Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Quilter’s Dream iron
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 20+ year old Rowenta with this one. It is perfect for ironing 1/4 inch seams for quilting. It’s heavy, the steam is plentiful, and the pointed tip works great for opening up the seams. If you are looking for a multipurpose iron, this might not be the one for you. The plate is not flat, like older irons, and thus my kids hate the way their perler bean creations turn out. So, the quilter in new is quite happy to have a solo purpose iron just for me!
customer_reviews.author: Big Ben 10 fan's mom

customer_reviews.title: This leaks
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this machine: I’ve had a number of Rowentas. Invariably they all leak. I love them when they work but I’m moving on to another brand. No longevity. Disappointing, .
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: eco-intelligence does not work well
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this iron at all. Unfortunately I missed the cut off date for returning. The iron has to heat up every time you start to iron. You can't fold something or grab more clothes from the dryer without the iron turning off and needing to reheat. I also don't like the switch that controls the eco-steam, dry iron and boost functions. It is too loose and always in the wrong spot. I'm so sorry I can't return this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Velk

customer_reviews.title: classy iron
customer_reviews.text: I have had this iron for a number of months and it is performing very well. It has a decorative design on the body which is kind of unusual and nice for an iron. I am a fan of Rowenta irons and this iron does not disappoint. I have no idea how energy efficient it is, and I usually use it on nearly the hottest temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Twister

customer_reviews.title: Made for men also
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my cheapskate sisters-in-law. She liked it very much, I don’t understand why she would like it when it’s my sissy brother who does all the ironing. Isn’t it ironic?
customer_reviews.author: José Cota

customer_reviews.title: Low performer
customer_reviews.text: This iron leaks, and for some reason I have to clean the surface of the iron frequently because of build up for which I can’t determine the cause. It is a heavy iron and gives no indication when it is about to shut off.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Harker

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: According to my online searches got it. But didn't get same quality. My mom Definitely didn't like it and also stopped working after a few months. Simple, don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tural Mehdiyev

customer_reviews.title: The Rowenta name has integrity but this product don’t live up to it for me
customer_reviews.text: The only iron I would purchase would be a Rowena for the past 40 years. I would like to add that I paid less for more durable Rowena’s. My iron is spitting water, which I resent. The steam power is not what is advertised. I’m disappointed but threw out the box so I am stuck
customer_reviews.author: V. M. Rock

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Iron!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this iron. I was looking for an iron that produced a good stream steam flow which this does not and performs no better than the Shark iron I already own. I'm surprised by the reviews that rate this item so highly. To make matters worse, this item is not eligible for a return....very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Doug F.

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Product broken, start leaking with no power on after 3yrs of use. Average use time is once every other week. Not sure why the quality is so bad and it says made in Germany......I had a Philip used for over 10yrs without a problem! Never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special, temp not consistent. Don’t recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry but I don’t recommend it, there nothing special about it and the cost is very high. The issue is that it won’t keep the temperature constant, it cool down way to much before it kicks on to bring it to the temperature that was set for.
customer_reviews.author: Dlance

customer_reviews.title: New is good.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my very old Rowenta that was held together with gaffer tape. Still worked well but looked terrible. This new one works well. The increase in steam holes on the pad gives a more even press.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Girl

customer_reviews.title: My greatest Steam Iron.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first top of the line Steam Iron. It gets the job done. It is a must have for dressing clothes because it leaves them really nice. Please take special attention for care instructions because these interactions will keep these Iron Steamer for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: CHEERS FOR THE ROWENTA IRON
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin???This is the most wonderful iron ever. I own a business and sell linens of all kinds..Shabby Chic, Vintage, etc. You can imagine the ironing I do. All types of fabric come out looking professionally ironed. Plus...my personal wardrobe looks better than ever. The weight of the Rowenta means "it" does the job.....never having to press down hard to get smooth results. Another major plus is the four hundred steam holes. Nearly all fabrics require a degree of steam...Rowenta steams evenly on all settings. Thanks Rowenta for such a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Gloria Long

customer_reviews.title: Really like this iron
customer_reviews.text: First, I am a Rowenta fan. I like the weight, feel and steam capabilities of their products. This iron has been great after a few months. It seems to be effective at lower heat settings than my previous model. I did use the vertical steam option which went okay. Might have been the fabric I was trying to straighten. Ended up ironing that fabric and it worked fine. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This is more then awesome. I have had many irons in the last 50 years but never a Rowenta. Boy am I late to the game. This is a amazing piece of equipment. Love it. A must for every household !
customer_reviews.author: Randall Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Professional results
customer_reviews.text: This iron is easy to use and light weight. I got it to replace another Rowenta which only needed to be replaced because it was dropped!
customer_reviews.author: JOJO

customer_reviews.title: GOOD IRON
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy ironing and this one is very easy to use. It has a good pointy tip for hard to reach spots. The steam function is strong.
customer_reviews.author: Shef

customer_reviews.title: Rubber dials start to breakdown and turn into a sticky mess
customer_reviews.text: Stay away! 1 year in the the rubber dials for steam control are breaking down and turning sticky. This residue transfers to your fingers and onto any fabric you are ironing. When my iron is not in use it is stored in a dry linen closet so there is absolutely no reason this should be happening. It is nigh on impossible to use conventional means to try and remove the residue and once the breakdown starts you cannot stop it, just stave it off for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Crostdo

customer_reviews.title: It leaks now
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 2 stars because it’s starting to leak. For the price paid for this, I would think it would have lasted for much longer than a few months. If it didn’t leak, I would give this 5stars
customer_reviews.author: John “Mr. So ExQuiiSiiTe” Oliver

customer_reviews.title: It's truly a great iron!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time today. The iron isn't too heavy and it made everything I ironed look so nice. I'm going to enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I actually love it it’s a little heavy but works great except it is leaking water while ironing
customer_reviews.author: KRISTEN FISHER

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron
customer_reviews.text: Love this iron. Works like a charm. Just pressed a bunch of pre-washed duck cloth and not a wrinkle to be found. My other iron was just not up to the task. Make sure you read all of your directions first and you will not have any problems with this iron. Very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone. It's also quite lovely to look at, love the design and color. My daughter thinks it's great.
customer_reviews.author: MoFarmgirl

customer_reviews.title: This Is The IRON I've Been Looking For!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this iron. I don't mind ironing my clothes ,but my last iron was cumbersome and didn't have the steam power this one has.. so far..this is a great iron. Creasing my shirts is important to me, and this iron has creasing power! Way Cool !!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good iron
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the "eco" gimmick and it's made setting steam output needlessly difficult. It seems like everything today is "eco" as some kind of marketing thing. People who buy irons care about their clothes and want them to look sharp. This iron does the job well and it really doesn't use that much water.
customer_reviews.author: John Meola

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This iron has been the best to date iron I have used since I started using one over 25 years ago. I do not know how to explain it but it has operated better than I could have imagined.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, would not recommend this iron
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t get hot enough, handle Is constantly wet whether I have the reservoir full or half full. Very disappointed, would not recommend this iron
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In the box.
customer_reviews.text: Looks fabulous. Found one after purchase I like a little more. Why shouldn't I h as ve two. Rowenta are wonderful. I explained to my daughter why she should have one and get rid of that thing she calls an iron. 😂
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Nicely knocksout wrinkles.
customer_reviews.text: Generally, this is a great iron but the heat knob setting can easily be dislodged and altered by fat fingers like mine. It can put out an amazing amount of steam to unwrinkle many obstinate creases. I actually like the weight; lighter irons often feel like they're not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sih

customer_reviews.title: Rowenta's are the best
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am pleased with this iron. My only problem is that it is heavier than I expected but it isn't a big deal. I wouldn't have any other iron but Rowenta. They are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Already broken
customer_reviews.text: Only had a month and already the steam function won't work.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Ancira

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement for my old iron
customer_reviews.text: My old iron finally gave up after many years. I researched many irons and found this one was the best option for my usage. The steam variability is really nice and an upgrade for me. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lundie

customer_reviews.title: Great iron, really speeds up ironing with great steam.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really very into ironing, but have to do it (hate cleaners, they always scorch my shirts!). When my old iron took a dump (literally pouring water out all over), I decided to upgrade. Great choice. This thing takes out the wrinkles in one pass with it's consistent steaming, the pointy nose really gets into places I'd ignored before. Really speeds up ironing, and that's a serious win. A good thing to get if you don't like ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Did not get hot enough and the bottom metal plate of the iron had ridges that reduced the surface area touching the fabric which exacerbated the issue. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan Oommen

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: I first Rowenta iron lasted 20+ years. IMO, they are the best. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: G1

customer_reviews.title: Nice engineering and visual cues update.
customer_reviews.text: My wife replaced an older Rowenta with this nearly sci-fi looking model and after a few test runs really likes it. And it’s much lighter and steams up a bit faster too. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F.

customer_reviews.title: Roweta is reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have used Roweta Irons in the past. They are reliable and durable. I had to replace mine after years of use because of a power outage during use. That can happen to any appliance. I am extremely satisfied and will never use another brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Renee R. Micou

customer_reviews.title: Great product, worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the price, I sew a lot, it great on all fabrics, follow directions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive for so little steam
customer_reviews.text: Do not expel steam strongly, the handle that turns right and left is useless
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice weight iron with steam that makes ironing easy. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: N. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Broke After a Few Hours
customer_reviews.text: The iron stopped working after a few hours of use. It started to leak and then it will not heat at all. Unfortunately, it is too late to return and get my money back,
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Hooked for life!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the very best Iron I have ever owned. Okay that is not saying much since I have only owned 2 before this one. This iron is so much better than my previous 2. I love the steam function on this iron. It is heavy enough that I don't have to press down hard. It makes ironing so much easier than my previous irons. I am hook on Rowenta irons for life!
customer_reviews.author: cindypi

customer_reviews.title: is good if you iron an hour or two a week
customer_reviews.text: general ironing of clothes. If you want steam buy the steam force. This model is a down sized model of the steam force. It doesn't provide the heat or steam and the controls aren't as convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Solidly made and very maneuverable
customer_reviews.text: A bit heavy, but actually that seems to help press clothes better. Very easy to use, especially like the extended nose for getting around buttons.
customer_reviews.author: mark veigl

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love Tina iron. My favorite ever so far and I'm an iron snob. Heats up quickly and has even temperature and great steam. I like a heavy iron to help get out wrinkles and thus one has some weight to it but definitely glides along easily.
customer_reviews.author: slinderman

customer_reviews.title: The best steam iron
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it have a very good steam,but this the reason i have to full it up with water very fast, &is also not light weight so it's very safe a stand sturdy so it shouldn't turn over easy. overall i'm very very satisfied with this prodouct i will recomand it for every body who is looking to buy a steam iron
customer_reviews.author: Simche

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT iron!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, glides over clothes. Steam option is fabulous and makes quick almost fun even work of ironing!
customer_reviews.author: Vapid

customer_reviews.title: Good not great...steam issues
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice iron, covers a lot of ground quickly...but I don't like the steam set up--the lever likes to switch to the steam off position on its own. I constantly have to switch it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ed

customer_reviews.title: No recommend
customer_reviews.text: dripping a lot of water, takes time to heat up, very heavy
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I've never owned a real iron before I got this. The pointy nose makes it easier to iron in darts and around tight areas. The blast of steam really is a big cloud burst. It gets those wrinkles out and makes ironing easier and faster. I'm glad I got this while I thought my old iron was still functional. Little did I know how much better this would turn out to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good iron
customer_reviews.text: I love Rowenta irons. This one is lightweight and does the job very well. I wish it had digital dial and the steam lever is very “cheap like”. It’ll be the first thing to break.
customer_reviews.author: NeptuneDiva

customer_reviews.title: (Which I loved. ) I wanted energy star
customer_reviews.text: Replacing old Oslio. (Which I loved.) I wanted energy star, and was suprised how few there are. I find this to be truly ugly, but I love it! It is cooler to iron with, yet it it presses quickly, evenly. The pointed tip also helpful. EXCELLENT job Rowenta! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Makes Ironing Faster
customer_reviews.text: It makes ironing faster and easier because there are so many more holes that extend all the way into the pointed design on the front of the plate. My only personal problem is the weight of the iron - that's because I have severe arthritis in my wrists and hands. For an ironer who doesn't experience my problem (such as my husband!) it would do a great job. I use it for short periods of time ironing the more delicate pieces.
customer_reviews.author: easw1

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight and Easy to Fill Water Tank
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old Rowenta quit working and I knew I was going to by another one to replace it. The color was not a first choice but everything else had exactly what I was looking for and I love it. I don’t mind ironing now.
customer_reviews.author: Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: From the first use you can tell this is a quality German product rather than a crappy Chinese POS
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if paying this much for an iron would make any difference. It totally does. From the first use you can tell this is a quality German product rather than a crappy Chinese POS. Worth it for the discerning consumer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Makes me want to iron!
customer_reviews.text: This iron is functional and beautiful! I have always used cheap irons but since my old iron started leaking I started doing a little research on irons. Rowenta is very highly rated and this one was so pretty so I decided to give it a try. It is very heavy which makes it very effective. I only need to iron one side of a sleeve to get both sides looking nicely pressed. The amount of steam is very impressive too. My ironing goes much faster now and looks better. I highly recommend this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Snowapple

customer_reviews.title: Works well, water needs constant refill
customer_reviews.text: Performs well, only drawback is that I need to refill water after each item I iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this brand
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of use. This is my 3rd Rowenta, and I love them all.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic iron. My old Rowenta was showing signs of ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic iron. My old Rowenta was showing signs of age, had it for over 10 years, this is a solid replacement, and I like the feature set better.
customer_reviews.author: gEoFFTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Have had a rowenta for years. I use it daily for my small home business. My old one started leaking so I did my research and ended up with the Eco intelligence. Love it. It is very precise with the tip, it heats up quickly and doesn't sputter like my old one did. Should have bought this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Happily anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Well designed iron all around!
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design and very nicely styled. Very easy to move around. Ironing results are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Rama

customer_reviews.title: Not im-'pressed'
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as well as would be expected for an updated model.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy H.

customer_reviews.title: this is my second iron in about 10 years.
customer_reviews.text: this is my second iron in about 10 years. The only thing that was a learning curve is the switch to increase steam sometimes flips back into the neutral postion
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Couture

customer_reviews.title: I love this iron!
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron! It is fairly light and presses really well. I had my previous Rowenta Iron for about 11 years and was sad to have to replace it, because a good iron is expensive! I actually like this one better and feel that I got a good deal vs what I would have paid in a retail store.
customer_reviews.author: Bookie Nookie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I was scared it wouldn't work as a dry iron, but it works great (with steam or without). This iron can knock down wrinkles like melting butter. No more cheap irons from Walmart for me! Life is too short to struggle with cheap irons.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Buy anything but this
customer_reviews.text: Item 'died' 5 weeks after purchase. Doesn't get hot anymore. Complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tomaczar

customer_reviews.title: The BEST iron on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Rowenta irons for years and have never been disappointed. I have tried different irons through the years and none of them can compare to this Rowenta.
customer_reviews.author: Smocker2

customer_reviews.title: Happy ironing!
customer_reviews.text: Gets hot really fast! Takes a while to cool down! Good sturdy iron and it has a very large water reservoir!
customer_reviews.author: Sami P.

customer_reviews.title: It is still working
customer_reviews.text: I use this item almost every day and it is still working.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Color plus great ironing.
customer_reviews.text: Mu wife after many years wore out her old Rowenta and she said this beats even that one which she really liked. Says it just glides over the clothes and is lighter and easy to fill and adjust the temps. She also loves the color that is a big change from the stainless steel look.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Wils

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Heats up fast and the pointed nose works great when ironing button-down shirts and corners. Works well (I've only had it for a couple of months though). It is heavier than what I'm used to and gets tiring on my wrist, and I wish there was an on/off button.
customer_reviews.author: Mylinh B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Iron
customer_reviews.text: Nice iron. Heavy... does a great job. I wish it were lighter though.
customer_reviews.author: Barb C.

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. It glides easily over fabric. Gives lots of steam when needed and has a large capacity water fill. It has an automatic shut off. So far I haven't seen anything I dislike about it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: Great iron - I spent more money to get a better iron and believe I got that in this model. Purchased $30-45 iron in the local store and couldn't stand it after 1 year. This irons faster and better than any brand I've had before. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy. Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This steam Iron does the job as described.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Good, but crappy eco/boost switch
customer_reviews.text: Good steam and balance. Con : the Eco/boost switch is very flimsy and switches to the off position if you barely touch it. Most of the times, does not stay in the boost position. Very annoying. Removing two stars because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Bought this over a year ago and it's worked as ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over a year ago and it's worked as expected, the real test and reason I bought it, how many more years will it last? Hopefully many more.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: This iron is amazing. I replaced a cheaper one I had bought ...
customer_reviews.text: This iron is amazing. I replaced a cheaper one I had bought about a year ago that wasn't working very well - and now I spend about 1/3 the time. Or less, ironing an item of clothing. It really made that much of a difference!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Always a Rowenta.
customer_reviews.text: It was the third Rowenta iron I have had in several years. They keep getting better each time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I always buy Rowenta irons because they are the best. This model is so easy to use and irons beautifully. Such excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: hopeful

customer_reviews.title: Good iron
customer_reviews.text: Heats up fast. Reduced my ironing time than my previous iron
customer_reviews.author: harjeets16

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: By far best iron I've ever used. Definitely worth the money. My female friend said I was nuts then tried it and proclaimed it was awesome and worth it. The steam blast is like old geyser coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Movie lover

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves the iron and my only comment would ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves the iron and my only comment would be that putting the right type of water into the iron has become a problem. We are on a water softner and apparently softened water really could harm the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred K. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome iron
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome iron with a great steaming feature... my new favorite!
customer_reviews.author: MCL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it... never had a so fancy and nice iron before
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Shavez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this iron! I've had it for a couple weeks now and can't imagine what I ever did without it!
customer_reviews.author: Rene T.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, but no internat cord storage.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of small holes for steam. Very smooth ironing surface. But my previous iron had an internal cord storage system that meant I didn't have to deal with the long cord while the iron is in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: great iron
customer_reviews.text: have been using rowenta irons forever, at least over 30 yrs. can't remember how long i had the last one this one handles well the heat seems even so far it is great
customer_reviews.author: EKW

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE It! It has a great sleek design
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE It! It has a great sleek design, nice pattern, easy to operate. It's definitely the best iron I have ever purchased or owned. Works great on most synthetics as well. However, some things to keep in mind: It's very heavy, and after unplugged/shut off it takes a very LONG time to cool down.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Michno

customer_reviews.title: Fine!
customer_reviews.text: My wife thinks it is the best iron she has ever had and, she has had a few!! The only point she made was that it felt a little heavy but despite that she spent 3 hours of ironing and had no ill effects nor had it overly tired her so I guess it IS fine!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Its good. I purchased it because it was 'eco friendly
customer_reviews.text: Its good. I purchased it because it was 'eco friendly,' I hope it is. Works very good. Still getting used to it. I am not the best ironer.
customer_reviews.author: Res555

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best performing iron I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: My iron if 30 years died and I needed a new one. This iron does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: ruby

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: A tad expensive but easily the best iron I've used. The steam alone is strong enough to pull most wrinkles out of shirts and it presses flat without much fuss + it's very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joshy G

customer_reviews.title: Not eco-friendly or intelligent
customer_reviews.text: I am soooo disappointed with this product. I love Rowenta and have used there irons for 15 years but this item broke after 6-8 months of use...the company replaced it with a new one in July and now in the middle of October it is malfunctioning. The steam function only works intermittently, it drips hot water on your feet and clothes and somethimes doesnt event appear to heat that well... I am all for envioronmentally friendly products but an iron that only works for six months and then winds up in a landfill is the opposite of that...
customer_reviews.author: mommy N

customer_reviews.title: Great iron but I wish the power cord was about 2 feet longer.
customer_reviews.text: Great iron but I wish the cord was about 2 feet longer. It's shorter than the cord on my old iron and now I have to move the board very close to the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID N.

customer_reviews.title: High quality iron
customer_reviews.text: Have used Rowenta for years. My old one finally retired. I love this newer model
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Light

product_meta.title: Rowenta DW6080 Eco-Intelligence 1700-Watt Energy Saving Steam Iron Stainless Steel Soleplate with Auto-Off, 400-Hole, Black
product_meta.description: Size:1700-WattIron more efficiently with this energy-saving Eco Intelligence DW6080 steam iron by Rowenta. The 1700-watt iron saves 25% more energy (compared to standard irons) while delivering professional results. With its exclusive Eco Steam system for optimal output, the iron offers three settings: Dry for a perfect finish without steam, Eco for superior steam while saving energy, and Boost for added steam when tackling thicker fabrics or uncompromising creases. An ergonomic rotary trigger makes activating the Eco Steam settings comfortable for both left- and right-handed users, and the steam output can be manually adjusted as needed. The iron’s scratch-resistant, stainless-steel soleplate features over 400 micro holes for thorough steam distribution, plus offers a unique 3D design that creates concentrated steam between the soleplate and fabric, reducing steam loss. Powerful steam with less waste means getting the job done with less energy. Gliding effortlessly across all fabrics, the rounded back end of the iron’s soleplate allows for a smooth back and forth motion without creating creases, while the pointed front end makes easy work of getting into tight spots like pleats or in between buttons. The versatile iron can also be used in the upright position for vertically steaming anything from hanging garments to drapes or slip covers. Other highlights include an anti-drip system to help prevent spitting or leaking at low heat settings, a self-clean system that flushes out loose mineral deposits for long-lasting performance, and three-way automatic shut-off for safety—the iron turns off automatically if left unused after 8 minutes in the upright position or after 30 seconds in the horizontal position or tipped over. Get through piles of shirts, slacks, cloth napkins, and more in no time with the Rowenta DW6080U6 Eco Intelligence steam iron.
feature_bullets: STAINLESS-STEEL SOLEPLATE W/ MICROSTEAM HOLES - Scratch-resistant, stainless-steel soleplate with high-precision tip; 3D design and 400 micro holes for concentrated steam and thorough distribution
ANTI-CALC SYSTEM - Integrated anti-scale system automatically collects scale, helping to extend the life of the iron.Power cord length (ft):7.9
SAFETY COMES FIRST WITH ROWENTA - 3-way auto-off feature shuts iron off after 8 Min. of inactivity on heel and 30 Sec. on soleplate or tipped over on its side
USER-FRIENDLY FEATURES - 1700 W. of power; vertical steam for hanging garments; works with regular tap water; anti-drip and self-clean systems; soft-grip handle
3 MANUAL STEAM SETTINGS - Dry for a perfect finish, Boost for stubborn creases (180g/Min.), and Eco for energy-saving steam; uses 25% less energy than standard irons
